verses.text: The \w word|strong="H1697"\w* of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* that came to \w Jeremiah|strong="H3414"\w* \w concerning|strong="H1697"\w* the \w dearth|strong="H1226"\w*.\f + \fr 14.1 \ft the dearth: Heb. the words of the dearths, or, restraints\f*

\w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* \w mourneth|strong="H0056"\w*, and the \w gates|strong="H8179"\w* thereof \w languish|strong="H0535"\w*; they are \w black|strong="H6937"\w* unto the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*; and the \w cry|strong="H6682"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* is gone \w up|strong="H5927"\w*.

And their \w nobles|strong="H0117"\w* have \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* their little \w ones|strong="H6810"\w* to the \w waters|strong="H4325"\w*: they \w came|strong="H0935"\w* to the \w pits|strong="H1356"\w*, \add and\add* \w found|strong="H4672"\w* no \w water|strong="H4325"\w*; they \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* with their \w vessels|strong="H3627"\w* \w empty|strong="H7387"\w*; they were \w ashamed|strong="H0954"\w* and \w confounded|strong="H3637"\w*, and \w covered|strong="H2645"\w* their \w heads|strong="H7218"\w*.

Because the \w ground|strong="H0127"\w* is \w chapt|strong="H2865"\w*, for there was no \w rain|strong="H1653"\w* in the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*, the \w plowmen|strong="H0406"\w* were \w ashamed|strong="H0954"\w*, they \w covered|strong="H2645"\w* their \w heads|strong="H7218"\w*.
Yea, the \w hind|strong="H0365"\w* also \w calved|strong="H3205"\w* in the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, and \w forsook|strong="H5800"\w* \add it\add*, because there was no \w grass|strong="H1877"\w*.

And the wild \w asses|strong="H6501"\w* did \w stand|strong="H5975"\w* in the high \w places|strong="H8205"\w*, they snuffed \w up|strong="H7602"\w* the \w wind|strong="H7307"\w* like \w dragons|strong="H8577"\w*; their \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* did \w fail|strong="H3615"\w*, because \add there was\add* no \w grass|strong="H6212"\w*.

¶ O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, though our \w iniquities|strong="H5771"\w* \w testify|strong="H6030"\w* against us, \w do|strong="H6213"\w* thou \add it\add* for thy \w name’s|strong="H8034"\w* sake: for our \w backslidings|strong="H4878"\w* are \w many|strong="H7231"\w*; we have \w sinned|strong="H2398"\w* against thee.

O the \w hope|strong="H4723"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*, the \w saviour|strong="H3467"\w* thereof in \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of \w trouble|strong="H6869"\w*, why shouldest thou be as a \w stranger|strong="H1616"\w* in the \w land|strong="H0776"\w*, and as a wayfaring \w man|strong="H0732"\w* \add that\add* turneth \w aside|strong="H5186"\w* to tarry for a \w night|strong="H3885"\w*?

Why shouldest thou be as a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w astonied|strong="H1724"\w*, as a mighty \w man|strong="H1368"\w* \add that\add* \w cannot|strong="H3201"\w* \w save|strong="H3467"\w*? yet thou, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add art\add* in the \w midst|strong="H7130"\w* of us, and we are \w called|strong="H7121"\w* by thy \w name|strong="H8034"\w*; \w leave|strong="H3240"\w* us not.\f + \fr 14.9 \ft we…: Heb. thy name is called upon us\f*

¶ Thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* unto this \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, Thus have they \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* to \w wander|strong="H5128"\w*, they have not \w refrained|strong="H2820"\w* their \w feet|strong="H7272"\w*, therefore the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* doth not \w accept|strong="H7521"\w* them; he will now \w remember|strong="H2142"\w* their \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w*, and \w visit|strong="H6485"\w* their \w sins|strong="H2403"\w*.
Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* unto me, \w Pray|strong="H6419"\w* not for this \w people|strong="H5971"\w* for \add their\add* \w good|strong="H2896"\w*.

When they \w fast|strong="H6684"\w*, I will not \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* their \w cry|strong="H7440"\w*; and when they \w offer|strong="H5927"\w* burnt \w offering|strong="H5930"\w* and an \w oblation|strong="H4503"\w*, I will not \w accept|strong="H7521"\w* them: but I will \w consume|strong="H3615"\w* them by the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, and by the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w*, and by the \w pestilence|strong="H1698"\w*.

¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* I, \w Ah|strong="H0162"\w*, \w Lord|strong="H0136"\w* \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*! behold, the \w prophets|strong="H5030"\w* \w say|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, Ye shall not \w see|strong="H7200"\w* the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*, neither shall ye have \w famine|strong="H7458"\w*; but I will \w give|strong="H5414"\w* you \w assured|strong="H0571"\w* \w peace|strong="H7965"\w* in this \w place|strong="H4725"\w*.\f + \fr 14.13 \ft assured…: Heb. peace of truth\f*

Then the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto me, The \w prophets|strong="H5030"\w* \w prophesy|strong="H5012"\w* \w lies|strong="H8267"\w* in my \w name|strong="H8034"\w*: I \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* them not, neither have I \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* them, neither \w spake|strong="H1696"\w* unto them: they \w prophesy|strong="H5012"\w* unto you a \w false|strong="H8267"\w* \w vision|strong="H2377"\w* and \w divination|strong="H7081"\w*, and a thing of \w nought|strong="H0457"\w*, and the \w deceit|strong="H8649"\w* of their \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*.

Therefore thus \w saith|strong="H0559"\w* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* concerning the \w prophets|strong="H5030"\w* that \w prophesy|strong="H5012"\w* in my \w name|strong="H8034"\w*, and I \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* them not, yet they \w say|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Sword|strong="H2719"\w* and \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* shall not be in this \w land|strong="H0776"\w*; By \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* and \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* shall those \w prophets|strong="H5030"\w* be \w consumed|strong="H8552"\w*.

And the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* to whom they \w prophesy|strong="H5012"\w* shall be cast \w out|strong="H7993"\w* in the \w streets|strong="H2351"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* \w because|strong="H6440"\w* of the \w famine|strong="H7458"\w* and the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*; and they shall have none to \w bury|strong="H6912"\w* \w them|strong="H1992"\w*, them, their \w wives|strong="H0802"\w*, nor their \w sons|strong="H1121"\w*, nor their \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w*: for I will \w pour|strong="H8210"\w* their \w wickedness|strong="H7451"\w* upon them.

¶ Therefore thou shalt \w say|strong="H0559"\w* this \w word|strong="H1697"\w* unto them; Let mine \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* run \w down|strong="H3381"\w* with \w tears|strong="H1832"\w* \w night|strong="H3915"\w* and \w day|strong="H3119"\w*, and let them not \w cease|strong="H1820"\w*: for the \w virgin|strong="H1330"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of my \w people|strong="H5971"\w* is \w broken|strong="H7665"\w* with a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w breach|strong="H7667"\w*, with a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w grievous|strong="H2470"\w* \w blow|strong="H4347"\w*.

If I go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* into the \w field|strong="H7704"\w*, then behold the \w slain|strong="H2491"\w* with the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w*! and if I \w enter|strong="H0935"\w* into the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*, then behold them that are \w sick|strong="H8463"\w* with \w famine|strong="H7458"\w*! yea, both the \w prophet|strong="H5030"\w* and the \w priest|strong="H3548"\w* go \w about|strong="H5503"\w* into a \w land|strong="H0776"\w* that they \w know|strong="H3045"\w* not.\f + \fr 14.18 \ft go about…: or, make merchandise against a land, and men acknowledge it not\f*

Hast thou \w utterly|strong="H3988"\w* \w rejected|strong="H3988"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*? hath thy \w soul|strong="H5315"\w* \w lothed|strong="H1602"\w* \w Zion|strong="H6726"\w*? why hast thou \w smitten|strong="H5221"\w* us, and \add there is\add* no \w healing|strong="H4832"\w* for us? we \w looked|strong="H6960"\w* for \w peace|strong="H7965"\w*, and \add there is\add* no \w good|strong="H2896"\w*; and for the \w time|strong="H6256"\w* of \w healing|strong="H4832"\w*, and behold \w trouble|strong="H1205"\w*!

We \w acknowledge|strong="H3045"\w*, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, our \w wickedness|strong="H7562"\w*, \add and\add* the \w iniquity|strong="H5771"\w* of our \w fathers|strong="H0001"\w*: for we have \w sinned|strong="H2398"\w* against thee.

Do not \w abhor|strong="H5006"\w* \add us\add*, for thy \w name’s|strong="H8034"\w* sake, do not \w disgrace|strong="H5034"\w* the \w throne|strong="H3678"\w* of thy \w glory|strong="H3519"\w*: \w remember|strong="H2142"\w*, \w break|strong="H6565"\w* not thy \w covenant|strong="H1285"\w* with us.

Are \w there|strong="H3426"\w* \add any\add* among the \w vanities|strong="H1892"\w* of the \w Gentiles|strong="H1471"\w* that can cause \w rain|strong="H1652"\w*? or can the \w heavens|strong="H8064"\w* \w give|strong="H5414"\w* \w showers|strong="H7241"\w*? \add art\add* not thou he, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our \w God|strong="H0430"\w*? therefore we will \w wait|strong="H6960"\w* upon thee: for thou hast \w made|strong="H6213"\w* all these \add things\add*.
